text: we have a wretched history when it comes
to race politics over the the last two
hundred and forty years that was not
going to be undone by eight years of a
black president but it can be undone by
a different kind of Senate and a
different and another white house this
can be done you spoke very movingly or
wrote very movingly after the killing
delivered a number of killings by police
of unarmed young black man in recent
years one was not so very far from your
congressional district Freddie gray in
Baltimore and after Freddie Gray's death
you wrote this about the fact you have
to talk to your own son way am i right
in saying is a teenager no no he's 27
okay but I think you were reflecting on
what you used to tell him when he was a
teenager you used to say to him if a
police officer stops you always make
sure they can see your hands don't reach
for anything please do not mouth off you
can do that when you get home safe is
that the way you still feel and other
black women who are the mothers of
teenage black sons feel today I think so
and I think it's a reality check look
the fact is that we have a lot of great
law enforcement officers but we also
have a culture within law enforcement
that has not always interacted well in
black communities and so I think that
there are things that we can do about
that things like law enforcement
training cultural sensitivity making
sure that we have transparency and
accountability and civilian
participation in that accountability
because the goal is that is as black
people we want to live in Safe
Communities to and so we have to have
law enforcement that worth in
cooperation with communities to make
them safe and we're a work in progress
so there's plenty of work to be done
